snippet: Flexible spending accounts allow you to set aside pretax money for medical expenses, but you lose the money if it is not spent by the annual deadline.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column notes that, as end of the year approaches, it is a is good time to check balance on flexible spending accounts, which allow people to set aside pretax money for medical expenses, in order to make sure funds are spent by annual deadline; notes that new federal regulations allow people to roll over up to $500 for the following year; offers tips on how to use up money in account.
lead_paragraph: Flexible spending accounts allow you to set aside pretax money for medical expenses, but you lose the money if it is not spent by the annual deadline.

headline.main: It’s Autumn, Time to Check Flexible Spending Accounts
headline.print_headline: It’s Autumn, Time to Check Flexible Spending Accounts
